comments:
When a new install of the tools is used, and no SDK has been defined, there are errors generated during project creation, and the wizard behaves inconsistently.

The first execution will not allow the user to create a runtime.  The second execution will create a runtime, but will not update to allow its selection.  The third execution works.  

This stack trace is generated on the first execution:

Hi!

I propose that we add there kind a wizard that forces to import one SDK when there is no existing yet.
E.g. the wizard has to check that is there >0 SDK defined, if not it activates an wizard that does force to import one (optionally forces/guides to download it).
This way the startup could be managed in all cases. 
If agreed, the question is that who does it?

-Arto

New project creation won't allow the system to continue unless there is an SDK created.  The problem is that the code being used to check is failing.  I think we  acheive your desired goal with the existing code.  You wouldn't want to force the user to create an SDK after just installing our component.  They may install the component (or have it installed in their setup by someone else) and never actually use it.

I am committing a small change so that the NewProject library selection page  (org.eclipse.mtj.extension.devide/.../MTJNewProjectSelectLibraryWizardPage) resets its page complete value when the runtime window is populated.  This will allow the wizard to continue correctly.  This does not remove all of the exceptions that are logged to the console.

Hi,

It looks like that some work has been done to this already.
Kevin, could you check this one and fix it or if it is fixed already then close this bug.

mho

I have changed the catch for this exception to output a message instead of a long exception.  The code reports this since the data directory is expected, but does not exist the first time.  We do not want to loose the message, because if it is generated later, it could mean the user deleted the directory or something is corrupt.
